message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on interactive machine learning for extending human capabilities, which is a core topic in human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The use of facial expressions as a means of conveying feedback and preferences is a key aspect of the paper, which suggests a connection to computer vision (cs.CV). The use of reinforcement learning to learn from the user's feedback is a central part of the paper, which suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the application of the approach to a grip selection task suggests a connection to robotics (cs.RO).
